description: Transport Canada has a requirement for a Contractor to provide safe and efficient water transportation services for Transport Canada Marine Safety Inspectors (MSI’s) to vessels (primarily oil tankers) in the Saint John New Brunswick Harbour, and its environs on an "as-and-when required" basis.
full_summary:
================================

### Water Transportation Services Request for Proposal

**Solicitation Number:** T1610-220005

**Period of the Contract:** August 1, 2023 to July 31, 2025, with two optional one-year extensions.

### Description of the Requirement

Transport Canada invites proposers to provide water transportation services for Transport Canada Marine Safety Inspectors (MSI’s) to vessels (primarily oil tankers) in the Saint John, New Brunswick Harbour, and its environs on an “as-and-when required” basis.

The successful bidder will provide all labour, equipment, and supervision necessary to perform the work as specified in the attached Statement of Work.

**Trade Agreements:** This requirement is subject to various international trade agreements, including the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), among others.

**Evaluation and Selection Methodology:** Proposals will be evaluated based on their compliance with the requirement and the Mandatory Technical Evaluation Criteria. The lowest-priced eligible proposal that meets the technical requirements will be recommended for award.

**Security Requirements:** No security requirements are associated with this requirement.

**Tender Documents:** The tender documents, including the Statement of Work, are available for download from the Governement of Canada Tenders website.

**Contact Information:** For any questions or inquiries, please contact Suzanne LeBreton at:

Suzanne LeBreton
TC.ATLFinanceContractingUnit-UniteMarchesFinancesATL.TC@tc.gc.ca
(506) 961-9268

### Delivery Location

The water transportation services will be provided in the Saint John, New Brunswick Harbour, and its environs.

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Notice of tender closing:** June 30, 2023, at 2:00 PM.

Caveats
--------------------------------

To ensure timely application submission: All responses to bidder inquiries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority no later than 8 calendar days before the closing date of the bid opportunity.

Enquiries received after this deadline may not be addressed prior to the bid closing date.

Expiration
----------

Please note: This tender opportunity expired on June 30, 2023. If you wish to obtain the latest information on this procurement, please read the attached notice.
